intro: Diapedium repens f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered diapedium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its flowers are simple and have five petals, with prominent stamens that add to its ornamental appeal. This variety is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display in shaded garden environments.
